title: Transhealth Primary Care Integrated Education: Scientific Inquiry and Evidence-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, understanding of primary care procedures, scientific inquiry methods and variable control concepts, and foundational transgender health terminology/protocols
context.additional_context: Project-based learning utilizing digital devices, focusing on integrating transgender health knowledge into existing medical systems. The learning process applies scientific methodologies such as hypothesis formulation, data measurement, analysis, and conclusion drawing, with particular emphasis on strengthening observation and evidence-gathering skills in medical settings.

learning_goals: Enhancing the ability to develop scientific treatment plans reflecting the physiological and psychological characteristics of transgender and non-binary patients (applying variable control and evidence-based approaches)
Developing case-based problem-solving skills integrating transgender health-related experimental results and evidence into existing clinical protocols (emphasizing data measurement and analysis)
Acquiring communication skills to respect the rights of transgender patients in multicultural environments and strengthening observational assessment capabilities (applying scientific methodologies)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
